page.title: 20DOMESDAY 1986
page.content: The Domesday work for this block is the result of co_operation between two schools.{Southway Junior}have acted as the data collectors, with{St.Wilfid's {RC Primary}acting as a feeder. Initial discussions were held to share the block into two halves for data collection and in sharing the topic matter.The{kilometre squares A to F were covered by Southway, G to L by St.Wilfrid's. Southway's work was by two 4th Year classes with Mr.Hair & Mrs.Tilbury, St.Wilfrid's with 2nd,3rd & 4th years led by Mrs.Jewell. {Pages}3,4,5,7,11,12 & 16 are largely Southway; 2,6,10,13,14,15, & 17, St.Wilfrids, the remainder are a combination arranged by Andrew Hair. The{photos and captions}are also his and were taken in July 1985. In that month the 160 children involved went on a joint walk to Wolstonbury Hill.
